original: de dag gi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgsum 'dus pa de ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni der rgyu dang 'bras bu'i @389a * //
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro // gsum 'dus pa de ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni der rgyu dang 'bras bu'i @389a * //
translated: because they are the results of those.üîΩThe three meeting is the condition for contact, and so on.

original: dngos po rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The three meeting is the condition for contact, and so on, because the state of cause and effect is complete there.

original: skad cig ma gsum pa la zhes bya ba ni reg par gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma gsum pa la tshor ba'o //üîΩde lta na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩgal te skad cig ma gsum pa la tshor ba yin no /
analyzed: skad cig ma gsum pa la zhes bya ba ni reg par gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma gsum pa la tshor ba'o // de lta na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / gal te skad cig ma gsum pa la tshor ba yin no /
translated: Feeling occurs in the third moment, because it is the condition for contact that is a form of consciousness.

original: de lta na ni reg pa'i dus tshor na tshor ba med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa thams cad la tshor ba yod par mi 'gyur te /üîΩreg par gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa la tshor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni reg pa'i dus tshor na tshor ba med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa thams cad la tshor ba yod par mi 'gyur te / reg par gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa la tshor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If feeling occurs in the third moment, then not all consciousnesses would have feeling, because feeling would not exist at the time of contact.üîΩIf feeling occurs in the third moment, then not all consciousnesses would have feeling, because feeling would not exist at the time of contact.

original: rnam par shes pa thams cad reg pa yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshor ba'i dus na reg pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad reg pa yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshor ba'i dus na reg pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: All consciousnesses would not be contact, because contact would not exist at the time of feeling.

original: 'dus pa'i 'og rol tshor ba'i dus na rnam par shes pa gang zhig skye ba de reg pa ma yin pas rnam par shes pa thams cad reg pa ma yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'dus pa'i 'og rol tshor ba'i dus na rnam par shes pa gang zhig skye ba de reg pa ma yin pas rnam par shes pa thams cad reg pa ma yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If consciousness that arises at the time of feeling after the assembly of three is not contact, then all consciousness would not be contact.

original: 'di ni 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But this is unacceptable,

original: reg pa dang tshor ba dag ni sa mang po pa yin pas sems thams cad la 'byung ba'i phyir dang rnam par shes pa thams cad reg pa yin no zhes khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg pa dang tshor ba dag ni sa mang po pa yin pas sems thams cad la 'byung ba'i phyir dang rnam par shes pa thams cad reg pa yin no zhes khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because contact and feeling are universal mental states and they occur in all minds and because you accept that all consciousness is contact.üîΩFeeling that exists at the time of subsequent contact arises from the cause of prior contact.

original: reg pa phyi ma la yod pa'i tshor ba reg pa snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba yin par zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni thams cad la tshor ba dang reg pa nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: reg pa phyi ma la yod pa'i tshor ba reg pa snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba yin par zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni thams cad la tshor ba dang reg pa nyid du 'dod pa yin no //
translated: This is because it is asserted that all feeling and contact occur together.

original: de ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i reg pa'i rkyen gyis yin pa nyid du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i reg pa'i rkyen gyis yin pa nyid du mi 'dod do //
translated: But it is not asserted that feeling exists simultaneously with contact.

original: 'o na de ga las yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de ga las yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then from what does feeling arise?

original: reg pa snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: reg pa snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba yin te /
translated: It arises from the cause of prior contact.

original: dbang po dang yul snga ma'i rgyu mtshan can gyi reg pa gang yin pa de las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul snga ma'i rgyu mtshan can gyi reg pa gang yin pa de las byung ba yin no //
translated: It arises from contact that has the former faculty and object as its cause.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar na dbang po dang don las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa rig pa yin pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar na dbang po dang don las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa rig pa yin pas /
translated: Because in this way, consciousness that arises from a faculty and object is aware,

original: reg pa thams cad tshor ba dang bcas pa yin la shes pa thams cad kyang reg pa yin te /
analyzed: reg pa thams cad tshor ba dang bcas pa yin la shes pa thams cad kyang reg pa yin te /
translated: all contact is accompanied by feeling, and all consciousness is contact.

original: des na 'gal ba med do /
analyzed: des na 'gal ba med do /
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction.

original: dmigs pa tha dad pa dag las zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang sgra la dmigs pa dag las so //
analyzed: dmigs pa tha dad pa dag las zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang sgra la dmigs pa dag las so //
translated: From those that have different objects means from those that have form and sound as their objects.

original: reg pa phyi ma la spyod pa'i tshor ba zhes bya ba ni sgra la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa phyi ma la spyod pa'i tshor ba zhes bya ba ni sgra la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The feeling that occurs with subsequent contact means that which has sound as its object.

original: reg pa snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs la dmigs pa'i reg pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: reg pa snga ma'i rgyu las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs la dmigs pa'i reg pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: It arises from the cause of prior contact means that it arises from the cause of contact that has form as its object.

original: ji ltar na zhes bya ba ni khro ba bsal bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na zhes bya ba ni khro ba bsal bar byed pa ste /
translated: How is this so? This is to remove any doubt.

original: reg pa dang tshor ba dag dmigs pa tha dad pa dag nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: reg pa dang tshor ba dag dmigs pa tha dad pa dag nyid yin na ni /
translated: If contact and feeling have different objects,üîΩthen how can feeling that has sound as its object arise from the cause of contact that has form as its object?

original: phyis byung ba'i tshor ba bde @389b ba'i sgo nas reg pa snga ma nam yang bde ba myong bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: phyis byung ba'i tshor ba bde @389b ba'i sgo nas reg pa snga ma nam yang bde ba myong bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: The prior contact that is the basis of the later feeling of pleasure never experiences pleasure.

original: reg pa'i stobs kyis dmigs pa nyams su myong ba yang yin pa'i phyir reg pa dang dmigs pa tha dad bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: reg pa'i stobs kyis dmigs pa nyams su myong ba yang yin pa'i phyir reg pa dang dmigs pa tha dad bar mi rung ste /
translated: And it is not tenable that contact and its focal object are different because the power of contact experiences the focal object.üîΩThus, how could contact that is to be experienced as pleasure cause the experience of pain?

original: 'di ltar bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pas sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar ji ltar byed yang na sems gang dang zhes bya ba'i sgra la dmigs pa dang / de las dmigs pa gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs la dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pas sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar ji ltar byed yang na sems gang dang zhes bya ba'i sgra la dmigs pa dang / de las dmigs pa gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs la dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Or else, the term ‚Äúwith what mind‚Äù means ‚Äúwith what focal object‚Äù and ‚Äúwith what is other than that focal object‚Äù means ‚Äúwith form as its focal object.‚Äù

original: 'di lta yin na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'di lta yin na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is wrong with that?

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i reg pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i nyes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i reg pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i nyes par 'gyur te /
translated: The error of not being concomitant with contact and so on that arise simultaneously would occur.

original: dmigs pa tha dad pas mtshungs pa nyid lngas mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa tha dad pas mtshungs pa nyid lngas mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They would not be concomitant through the five types of concomitance because their focal objects would be different.

original: sdug bsngal dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la yang de dang 'dra bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for that which is neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: 'o na de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa 'pho ba'i tshe ste mi 'pho na ni nyes pa med do //üîΩji ltar zhe na gal te gzugs la dmigs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mjug thogs su mig gi rnam par shes pa'am /
analyzed: 'o na de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa 'pho ba'i tshe ste mi 'pho na ni nyes pa med do // ji ltar zhe na gal te gzugs la dmigs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mjug thogs su mig gi rnam par shes pa'am /
translated: But at that time, when the object is changing, there is no fault if there is no change.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gzugs la dmigs pa kho na 'byung na ni tshor ba dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gzugs la dmigs pa kho na 'byung na ni tshor ba dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: How is that? If, immediately after a visual consciousness that has form as its object, a visual consciousness arises, or a mental consciousness arises that has form as its object, then it is accompanied by feeling.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sngar skyes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa yin pas rigs gcig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar skyes pa mig gi rnam par shes pa yin pas rigs gcig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: de'i sngon rol gyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de'i sngon rol gyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Prior to that, a consciousness that has form as its object is not accompanied by feeling.

original: ci'i phyir de reg pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de reg pa ma yin zhe na /

original: 'di la rgyu smos pa ni rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu smos pa ni rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ste /
translated: The cause is stated here: because the conditions are incomplete.

original: 'di ltar mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen thams cad kyis ni tshor ba'i rkyen gyis reg par gyur pa skyed par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen thams cad kyis ni tshor ba'i rkyen gyis reg par gyur pa skyed par mi nus so //
translated: Thus, no condition as an equivalent and immediate antecedent can generate contact that is conditioned by feeling.

original: gzhan dag na re 'dir rkyen ma tshang ba ni dbang po 'pho ba dang / de las skyes pa'i yid la byed pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'dir rkyen ma tshang ba ni dbang po 'pho ba dang / de las skyes pa'i yid la byed pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the deficiency of conditions here is the transference of faculties and the attention that arises from that.

original: de lta yin na nyes pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa tha dad pa'i nyes pa med do snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na nyes pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa tha dad pa'i nyes pa med do snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: What is wrong with that? He thinks that there is no fault of having different objects because they do not exist.

original: sa mang po pa'i nges pa nyams pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sems thams cad la reg pa dang tshor ba dag med pa'i phyir te nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa mang po pa'i nges pa nyams pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sems thams cad la reg pa dang tshor ba dag med pa'i phyir te nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: The certainty of the universal mental factors is violated, because contact and feeling do not exist for all minds.

original: sa ni gsum ste zhes bya ba la rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang @390a * //
analyzed: sa ni gsum ste zhes bya ba la rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang @390a * //
translated: There are three levels: the level with investigation and analysis is the desire realm and the first absorption.

original: po'o ; / rtog pa med par dpyod pa tsam ni bsam gtan khyad par can no //
analyzed: po'o ; / rtog pa med par dpyod pa tsam ni bsam gtan khyad par can no //
translated: The mere analysis without conceptualization is the special meditative stabilization.üîΩ

original: rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa nas /
analyzed: rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa nas /
translated: The stage of the first meditation is the stage of the first meditation and the stage of the second meditation is the stage of the second meditation, and so on up to:

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar ro //

original: dge ba'i sa ni chos dge ba rnams te /
analyzed: dge ba'i sa ni chos dge ba rnams te /

analyzed: slob pa'i sa ni slob pa'i zag pa med pa'i chos dag go //

analyzed: mi slob pa ni mi slob pa'i zag pa med pa'i chos dag go //

analyzed: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'i ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos dag go //

original: 'dus ma byas ni ma bshad de /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni ma bshad de /
translated: The unconditioned is not mentioned because

analyzed: sa rnams 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'don pa'i zhar la zhes bya ba ni mdo 'don pa'i zhar la ste /
analyzed: 'don pa'i zhar la zhes bya ba ni mdo 'don pa'i zhar la ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúin the course of reciting‚Äù means in the course of reciting the s≈´tras.

original: mdo las ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: mdo las ni 'di skad du /
translated: The s≈´tras state:üîΩ‚Äúthe wholesome, the unwholesome, and the neutral.‚Äù

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa zhes 'don te /üîΩaa sam dzi ta /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa zhes 'don te /üîΩaa sam dzi ta /
translated: asamprajanya

original: lhag par sgro btags pa'o //
analyzed: lhag par sgro btags pa'o //
translated: It is a superimposition.

original: da ni bye brag tu smra ba'i skye ba yod par byas nas sngon ni ma bton to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: da ni bye brag tu smra ba'i skye ba yod par byas nas sngon ni ma bton to zhes bya ba la /
translated: Now, the Vaibhasikas, having accepted that arising exists, say, It was not mentioned previously.

original: rab tu byed pa'i rkang pa las /üîΩsa mang po pa dang / dge ba'i sa mang po ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po ba dang / nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i sa mang po pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa'i rkang pa las / sa mang po pa dang / dge ba'i sa mang po ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po ba dang / nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i sa mang po pa ste /
translated: The root text of the treatise says:üîΩThere are four types of universal mental states: universal virtuous mental states, universal mental afflictions, and universal mental factors of afflicted states.

original: rnam pa bzhi kho na 'don gyi mi dge ba'i sa mang po ba dag ni ma yin no //üîΩlhan cig skyes pa zhes gsungs kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi kho na 'don gyi mi dge ba'i sa mang po ba dag ni ma yin no // lhan cig skyes pa zhes gsungs kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: It does not mention universal nonvirtuous mental states.üîΩThe sutra says that feeling, discernment, and intention are coemergent.

analyzed: mdo de las ni tshor ba dang 'du shes dang / sems pa lhan cig skyes zhes gsungs kyi /

analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pas rnams reg pa dang lhan cig par khas blangs kyang tshor ba dang reg pa dang dus mnyam du skye bar shes par mi 'gyur ro //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: lhan cig ces bya ba'i sgra 'di ni de ma thag pa la yang mthong ngo //

analyzed: byams pa dang lhan cig par gyur pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: For example, the statement ‚Äúaccompanied by love‚Äù

analyzed: byams pa dang dran pa yang dag pa byang chub kyi yan lag gnyis skad cig ma gcig la lhan cig 'byung bar shes par ni mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are contaminated and uncontaminated, respectively.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What does it indicate?

analyzed: byams pa'i mjug thogs su dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag sgom par byed do zhes @390b bya bar rtogs par 'gyur te /

analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni reg pa dang tshor ba lhan cig 'byung ba nyid kyi khungs su mi rung ngo //

original: chos de dag ni 'dres pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos de dag ni 'dres pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: These factors are mixed.

analyzed: 'dres shing lhan cig 'byung ba la mtshungs par ldan zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúmixed‚Äù is that they arise simultaneously and are associated.

translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe same time‚Äù means that they arise in the same moment.üîΩDo they experience the same object in sequence?

analyzed: 'du shes kyis 'dus te shes par byed dam /
translated: Do they experience the same object simultaneously?

analyzed: 'on te skad cig gang kho na la tshor bas tshor bar byed pa'i skad cig de kho na la sems pas sems par byed /
translated: Or else, in the moment when feeling feels, in that same moment, intention intends, and in that same moment, consciousness cognizes.

analyzed: 'du shes kyis 'dus te shes par byed ces de ni mi shes te the tshom za ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: But this is not known, because it is doubtful.

original: / de'i phyir 'di yang khungs su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: / de'i phyir 'di yang khungs su mi rung ngo //

original: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i sa pa ni rang gi sa la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa brgyad kho na dang ldan te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i sa pa ni rang gi sa la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa brgyad kho na dang ldan te /

analyzed: yid bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba gzugs dang sgra dang chos la dmigs pa rnams dang ngo //

analyzed: 'dir yang ji ltar srid pa bzhin brjod par bya'o //

original: dri dang ro la dmigs pa ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni //

analyzed: sa 'og mar skyes pas sa gong ma'i sems ma thob pa'o //

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems thob pa zhes bya ba ni mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa'i yin gyi dngos gzhi ni ma yin te 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems thob pa zhes bya ba ni mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa'i yin gyi dngos gzhi ni ma yin te 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'di ltar mi lcogs pa med pa thob nas gzod 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: 'dod pa spyod pa thams cad las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //

original: 'dod pa'i khams pa 'dod chags dang ma bral bas yid bde ba nye bar rgyu ba bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi'i sa pa nyon mongs pa can bzhi kho na dang ldan gyi /

analyzed: dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dag dang ni ma yin te sbyor ba dang skye ba la rag las pa'i phyir ro //

original: dri dang ro la dmigs pa ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dri dang ro la dmigs pa ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Except for those that focus on smell and taste.

analyzed: dri dang ro la nye bar rgyu ba dag gcig tu dge ba yin pa'i phyir ro // mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa la dmigs pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa rnams kyi'o //

original: mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa'i btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba drug dang ldan no zhes bya ba ni mi lcogs pa med @394b ba'i sa ba'i sems thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa'i btang snyoms kyi nye bar rgyu ba drug dang ldan no zhes bya ba ni mi lcogs pa med @394b ba'i sa ba'i sems thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who obtain the mind of unrestricted access concentration possess six neutral mental factors of unrestricted access concentration.

analyzed: bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi'i sa pa bzhi dang mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa drug ste de ltar na bcur 'gyur ro //
translated: There are four on the level of the actual basis of absorption and six on the level of unrestricted access concentration.

analyzed: btang snyoms kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang sa tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: snga ma bzhin te zhes bya ba la bsam gtan dag tu dri dang ro ma gtogs pa bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa ni brgyad dang ldan no //

analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa'i sa pa ni bzhi dang ldan no //

analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa ni nyon mongs pa can gcig kho na dang ldan no zhes bya bar thams cad la khong du chud par bya'o //

analyzed: srol 'dis zhes bya ba ni lugs sam tshul 'dis so //

original: 'di'i ni mdor bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i ni mdor bsdus pa'o //

analyzed: sa 'og mar skyes pa de yang sa gong ma pa'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan gyi /

analyzed: skyed pa las ni lung du ma bstan pa dang yang ldan no //

analyzed: drug tu 'gyur zhing ji ltar srid pa ltar bcu gnyis su yang ngo //

analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i nyer bsdogs rnams ni sa 'og ma la dmigs pa rnams so zhe na ma yin te /

analyzed: der dri dang ro la nye bar rgyu ba dag lam gyis spangs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba smos pa ni de dag kyang 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term nonreturner is mentioned because they are free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: mthong pa'i gzugs su zas kyi bya ba byed pa ni ji ltar dri dang / ro dang / reg bya mid bzhin pa dag bzhin du phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang dgra bcom pa la yang byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthong pa'i gzugs su zas kyi bya ba byed pa ni ji ltar dri dang / ro dang / reg bya mid bzhin pa dag bzhin du phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang dgra bcom pa la yang byed par 'gyur te /
translated: The function of food is to be consumed, but the form of the eyes and so on is not consumed like smell, taste and tactility.

original: 'di skad du kham gyi zas ni lag na yod pa 'am snod na yod pas zas kyi bya ba mi byed kyi /
analyzed: 'di skad du kham gyi zas ni lag na yod pa 'am snod na yod pas zas kyi bya ba mi byed kyi /
translated: The function of food is not to be performed by food held in the hand or in a vessel.

original: 'on kyang gang gi tshe khar bcug pa dang / so sa mnal ba dang / mchil mas brlan pa dang / mid pa dang / pho ba khengs par gyur ba zhes bya ba rgyas bar srin bu'i rigs rnams la phan par gyur pa de'i tshe zas nyid kyi skye mched du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang gi tshe khar bcug pa dang / so sa mnal ba dang / mchil mas brlan pa dang / mid pa dang / pho ba khengs par gyur ba zhes bya ba rgyas bar srin bu'i rigs rnams la phan par gyur pa de'i tshe zas nyid kyi skye mched du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: But when it is placed in the mouth, the teeth chew it, saliva wets it, it is swallowed, and it fills the stomach, then it is called food and it is the source of the worms.

original: zas kyi dngos po byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zas kyi dngos po byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term is that it functions as food.

original: de ni gong bu mtha' dag lag pa la sogs pa na yod pa na 'byung par 'gyur ba'i ming gis kham gyi zas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni gong bu mtha' dag lag pa la sogs pa na yod pa na 'byung par 'gyur ba'i ming gis kham gyi zas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The entire mass of food in the hand and so on is called oral food because it is the cause of the arising of the worms.

original: gang gi tshe zas kyi bya ba byed pa de'i tshe dri dang ro dang reg bya kho na zas kyi ming thob ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zas kyi bya ba byed pa de'i tshe dri dang ro dang reg bya kho na zas kyi ming thob ste /
translated: When it functions as food, only smell, taste, and tactility are called food,

original: 'di de'i tshe yul du 'gyur bas so ;
analyzed: 'di de'i tshe yul du 'gyur bas so ;
translated: because at that time they are the object of the sense faculties.

original: / ci ste gzugs kyang zhes smos te /
analyzed: / ci ste gzugs kyang zhes smos te /
translated: If you assert that form is also food,

original: dri la sogs pa bzhin de ltar 'dod na mi ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi rang bzhin sgra yang zas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: dri la sogs pa bzhin de ltar 'dod na mi ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi rang bzhin sgra yang zas su 'gyur te /
translated: then sound, which is by nature nonconcurrent, would also be food, just like smell and so on.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched kyi mthar lto par gnas pas phan par byed pas so zhes so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched kyi mthar lto par gnas pas phan par byed pas so zhes so //
translated: because it is the support of the sense-sphere of visible form, and because it is the support of the other four sense-faculties.

original: 'di ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /üîΩdri la sogs pa bzhin so sor nus pa mthong pa'i phyir de'i tshe yang de'i yul rnam par shes pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ji ltar shes par bya zhe na / dri la sogs pa bzhin so sor nus pa mthong pa'i phyir de'i tshe yang de'i yul rnam par shes pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How do you know that?üîΩBecause, like odor, etc., it is perceived by a sense-faculty that is capable of being localized.

original: dri tsam zas yin pa ni re zhig yod do zhes 'grub bo //
analyzed: dri tsam zas yin pa ni re zhig yod do zhes 'grub bo //
translated: The sense-faculty of touch is the nutriment called contact, because it is the support of contact.

original: gzhan dag na re gzugs ni zas ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gzugs ni zas ma yin te /
translated: The other masters say: Visible form is not nutriment,

original: phrad nas 'dzin pa'i dbang po'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir sgra bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: phrad nas 'dzin pa'i dbang po'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir sgra bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: because it is not the object of a sense-faculty that seizes its object by contact, like sound, etc.

original: slob dpon dpal len na re /
analyzed: slob dpon dpal len na re /
translated: The master Sa·πÉghabhadra says:

original: gang zhig 'dus pa 'di dag thams cad kyis za bar byed pas zas te tha dad med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig 'dus pa 'di dag thams cad kyis za bar byed pas zas te tha dad med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The S≈´tra teaches that nutriment is that which nourishes, without making any distinction.

original: gang gi phyir 'di yongs su 'gyur ba las bcud dang khrag dang shal sogs pa'i ngo bo bsgrub pa'i phyir rgyud nye bar rton @401b par byed pa de'i phyir 'di thams cad zas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di yongs su 'gyur ba las bcud dang khrag dang shal sogs pa'i ngo bo bsgrub pa'i phyir rgyud nye bar rton @401b par byed pa de'i phyir 'di thams cad zas so zhes zer ro //
translated: Because it is the cause that supports the continuum of the body, since it produces the essence of the body, blood, flesh, and so on, from the transformation of the food, therefore all of this is food.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa kho na zas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa kho na zas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Only that which is contaminated is called food.

original: 'di nyid du zag pa dang bcas pa smos pa ni dri la sogs pa rnams la ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid du zag pa dang bcas pa smos pa ni dri la sogs pa rnams la ma yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúonly that which is contaminated‚Äù is stated here because smell and so on are not food,

original: de dag kho na mthar zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kho na mthar zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: srid pa gso par byed pa'i don zas kyi don zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: srid pa gso par byed pa'i don zas kyi don zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of food is the meaning of nourishing existence.

original: ji ltar na de dag srid pa gso bar byed ce na ma 'phangs pa 'phen pa'i phyir dang / 'phangs pa mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ji ltar na de dag srid pa gso bar byed ce na ma 'phangs pa 'phen pa'i phyir dang / 'phangs pa mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i phyir te /

original: srid pa rjes su mi srid pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: srid pa rjes su mi srid pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because they are the cause of the non-cessation of existence, that is the meaning.

original: reg pa dang sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa zag pa med pa de dag ni srid pa zad par bya ba'i phyir skyes pa dag yin te srid pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg pa dang sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa zag pa med pa de dag ni srid pa zad par bya ba'i phyir skyes pa dag yin te srid pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Contact, volition, and consciousness that are uncontaminated are born in order to exhaust existence, because they are the antidote to existence.

original: gal te yang skyes zin pa'i srid pa rgyas par byed mod kyi srid pa gzhan skyed par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang skyes zin pa'i srid pa rgyas par byed mod kyi srid pa gzhan skyed par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Even though they do increase the birth of existence, they do not generate other existence.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag zag pa dang bcas pa yin yang khams dang sa dang skal ba mi mnyam pa dag ni zas ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag zag pa dang bcas pa yin yang khams dang sa dang skal ba mi mnyam pa dag ni zas ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though they are contaminated, they are not food in the realms, stages, and destinies.

original: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i sa na ni rgyas pa'i rgyu nyid yin na yang phyi ma la srid pa de sbrel ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir zas ma yin no //
analyzed: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i sa na ni rgyas pa'i rgyu nyid yin na yang phyi ma la srid pa de sbrel ba'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir zas ma yin no //
translated: Even though they are the cause of increase in different stages, they are not food because they are not the cause of connecting to subsequent existence.üîΩThe four foods

original: zas bzhi po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: zas bzhi po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The four foods are as follows:

original: de la gnas pa ni mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni mi 'chad pa'o //

original: 'tsho ba ni rgyun chags su rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba ni rgyun chags su rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: Living means continuously engaging.

original: yang na ni snga ma'i bshad pa phyi ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na ni snga ma'i bshad pa phyi ma yin no //
translated: Or the latter explanation is for the former.

original: phan par byed pa ni yang srid pa mngon par 'grub par byed ba'o //
analyzed: phan par byed pa ni yang srid pa mngon par 'grub par byed ba'o //
translated: That which is beneficial is that which establishes manifest existence.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni de lta ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad par ram /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni de lta ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad par ram /
translated: But uncontaminated states are not like that.

original: yang srid pa mngon par 'grub pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: yang srid pa mngon par 'grub pa ma yin pa ste /

original: de'i phyir reg pa la sogs pa rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa kho na zas yin gyi zag pa med pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar mdo las khong du chud do //
analyzed: de'i phyir reg pa la sogs pa rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa kho na zas yin gyi zag pa med pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar mdo las khong du chud do //
translated: Therefore, it is understood from the sutra that only contaminated contact, etc. are food, not uncontaminated states.

original: re zhig byung ba ni zhes bya ba la byung ba ni skyes pa dang mngon par grub pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: re zhig byung ba ni zhes bya ba la byung ba ni skyes pa dang mngon par grub pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: First, that which has arisen means that which has been born and that which has been established.

original: yid las skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yid tsam las skyes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yid las skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yid tsam las skyes pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it arises from the mind alone means because it arises from the mind alone.

original: de ltar na yid kho na smos pa 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yid kho na smos pa 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, only the mind is mentioned, along with its result, but not others.

original: 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir phyi'i khu chu dang khrag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos @402a * //
analyzed: 'di nyid bstan pa'i phyir phyi'i khu chu dang khrag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos @402a * //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúExternal semen and blood, etc.‚Äù

original: te ; / sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sbras ni gcin dang phyis dang 'dam rdzab dang me tog la sogs pa rnams bsdu'o //üîΩdri za ba'i phyir na zhes bya ba ni dri za ba dang dri zas su za ba'i phyir na zhes bya ba'i don te srid pa tshol ba'i dang tshul can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: te ; / sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sbras ni gcin dang phyis dang 'dam rdzab dang me tog la sogs pa rnams bsdu'o // dri za ba'i phyir na zhes bya ba ni dri za ba dang dri zas su za ba'i phyir na zhes bya ba'i don te srid pa tshol ba'i dang tshul can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: and so on refers to urine, feces, mud, flowers, and so on.üîΩBecause they eat odors means because they eat odors and because odors are their food.

analyzed: ma skyes pas phal cher skye ba la gzhol ba ni srid pa tshol ba'i dang tshul can no //

original: skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they are directed toward birth means

analyzed: de'i don du mngon par grub pa'i phyir dang / de ma thag tu skye ba'i phyir na skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'o //

analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

analyzed: gnod pa dang bcas pa'i lus mngon par grub nas zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: Having established a body that is subject to harm,

analyzed: srid pa bar ma mngon par grub pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: he is said to have established the intermediate existence.üîΩIn both explanations, the source is this:

original: rnam par bshad pa gnyis su yang de'i khungs ni sdug bsngal dang bcas pas gnod pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa gnyis su yang de'i khungs ni sdug bsngal dang bcas pas gnod pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di yin te /

analyzed: gang gi phyir sngar mngon par grub nas gnod ba dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten du skye ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mu bzhi gsungs pa'i phyir ci yin zhe na / srid pa bar ma mngon bar grub bar brjod do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Why is it said that there are four possibilities?

original: gzhan dag ni so so skye bo'i zhes so //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni so so skye bo'i zhes so //
translated: Others are ordinary beings.

original: gnyis pa ni bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: The second is the once-returner.

original: gsum pa ni dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: The third is the non-returner.

analyzed: yang na byung ba ni dgra bcom pa'o zhes bya ba ni byung ba dang skyes zin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: srid pa tshol ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: srid pa tshol ba ni ma yin te /
translated: They do not seek existence,

original: khams gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are free from attachment to the three realms.

original: srid pa tshol ba rnams ni sred pa dang bcas pa dag go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: srid pa tshol ba rnams ni sred pa dang bcas pa dag go zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those who seek existence are those who have craving.

original: de dag ni 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i @402b phyir srid pa tshol ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i @402b phyir srid pa tshol ba yin no //
translated: They seek existence because they are not free from attachment.üîΩHow many nutriments sustain sentient beings who have already

original: yang zas du zhig ni sems can 'byung ba rnams gnas par byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni sems can skyes pa rnams gnas pa'i rgyu yin zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩdu zhig ni srid ba tshol ba rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni yang srid pa tshol ba rnams kyi yang srid pa mngon bar 'grub pa'i rgyu yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang zas du zhig ni sems can 'byung ba rnams gnas par byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni sems can skyes pa rnams gnas pa'i rgyu yin zhes bya ba'i don to // du zhig ni srid ba tshol ba rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni yang srid pa tshol ba rnams kyi yang srid pa mngon bar 'grub pa'i rgyu yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: arisen?üîΩHow many nutriments benefit those who seek existence?

original: thams cad kyang gnyis ka yin no zhes bya ba'i zas bzhi car sems can byung ba rnams gnas par byed pa dang / srid pa tshol bar byed ba rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang gnyis ka yin no zhes bya ba'i zas bzhi car sems can byung ba rnams gnas par byed pa dang / srid pa tshol bar byed ba rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: All four nutriments sustain sentient beings who have already arisen and benefit those who seek existence.

original: gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: yid la sems pa ni las kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: yid la sems pa ni las kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: because mental intention is the nature of karma.

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rig pa dang / rnam par shes pa ni de dang 'bras bu gcig pa'i phyir dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba yin pa'i phyir srid pa tshol ba rnams la phan 'dogs la rag na /

translated: And because the consciousness and knowledge concomitant with it have the same result as that intention and are virtuous or nonvirtuous, they benefit those who seek existence.

analyzed: kham gyi zas las kyi bdag nyid ma yin zhing lung du ma bstan pa go ci ltar srid pa tshol bar byed pa rnams la phan 'dogs par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: But how can oral food, which is not karma by nature and is neutral, benefit those who seek existence?üîΩTherefore it says,

original: de'i phyir kham gyi zas kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir kham gyi zas kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúEven oral food is like that.‚Äù

original: don 'di shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don 'di shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To understand this point,üîΩthe BhagavƒÅn said,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis zas bzhi ni zhes bya ba la sogs smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe four foods are the root of sickness,üîΩblisters, tumors, and so on,üîΩand old age and death.‚Äù

original: nad dang 'bras dang / zung rngu dang rga shi rnams ni mdo 'di las yang byung ba'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i rnam grangs kyi tshig tu gsungs te /
analyzed: nad dang 'bras dang / zung rngu dang rga shi rnams ni mdo 'di las yang byung ba'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i rnam grangs kyi tshig tu gsungs te /
translated: In this sutra, sickness, blisters, tumors, and so on, and old age and death are stated as synonyms for the five appropriated aggregates.

analyzed: zung rngu'i rtsa ba yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

original: de yang 'byung ba'i rgyu ni zas bzhi ste /
analyzed: de yang 'byung ba'i rgyu ni zas bzhi ste /
translated: The cause of origination is the four nutriments.

original: rtsa ba dang rgyu dang byed rgyu zhes bya ba ni don gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba dang rgyu dang byed rgyu zhes bya ba ni don gzhan ma yin no //
translated: The terms ‚Äúroot cause‚Äù and ‚Äúcontributory cause‚Äù are not different in meaning.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na mdo las kham gyi zas kyang de la chags pa rnams kyi lang 'byung bar byed pa yin no zhes bya bar grub po /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na mdo las kham gyi zas kyang de la chags pa rnams kyi lang 'byung bar byed pa yin no zhes bya bar grub po /
translated: Thus, it is established that the S≈´tra intends to say that material food is the cause of the origination of those who are attached to it.

original: 'di ltar kham gyi zas ni sed pa 'ga' zhig gi gegs dang / yang srid kyi las kyi 'phen par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar kham gyi zas ni sed pa 'ga' zhig gi gegs dang / yang srid kyi las kyi 'phen par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Material food is the obstacle to the cessation of some who are attached to it, and it is the projecting cause of rebirth.

original: gzhan dag ni rga shi'i rkyen yin no zhes bya ba 'di kho na dper brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rga shi'i rkyen yin no zhes bya ba 'di kho na dper brjod pa yin te /
translated: Others say that the S≈´tra intends to say that the four nutriments are the condition of old age and death.

original: bdag 'di'i 'og rol du rga shi rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems so //üîΩ'dir kham gyi zas @403a * //
analyzed: bdag 'di'i 'og rol du rga shi rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems so // 'dir kham gyi zas @403a * //
translated: This is the only example that is mentioned, because old age and death are established as subsequent to birth.

original: ni sems can byung ba rnams gnas par byed pa yin no zhes bya bar mngon sum gyis mthong la /
analyzed: ni sems can byung ba rnams gnas par byed pa yin no zhes bya bar mngon sum gyis mthong la /
translated: Here, material food is seen by direct perception to be the cause of the continuation of sentient beings who have already arisen.

original: de bzhin du bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa yang sems can byung ba rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin la rag na /
analyzed: de bzhin du bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa dang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par shes pa yang sems can byung ba rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin la rag na /
translated: Similarly, contact that is to be experienced as pleasure and the consciousness that is concomitant with it benefit sentient beings who have already arisen.

original: yid la sems pa ni ji ltar sems can byung ba rnams gnas par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yid la sems pa ni ji ltar sems can byung ba rnams gnas par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: But how does intention benefit sentient beings who have already arisen?

original: de'i phyir yid la sems pa yang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yid la sems pa yang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: To explain this, he says, ‚ÄúIntention also . . .‚Äù

original: drung du song zhes bya ba ni drung du rab tu son pa'o //
analyzed: drung du song zhes bya ba ni drung du rab tu son pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúApproaching‚Äù means arriving.

original: 'gro ba'i rnam grangs las kyang zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos zhig las so //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rnam grangs las kyang zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos zhig las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the enumeration of the ways of going‚Äù means from a treatise on Abhidharma.

original: chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos ni drug ste /
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos ni drug ste /
translated: There are six treatises on Abhidharma:

original: ye shes la 'jug pa dang / rab tu byed pa'i rkang pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs dang / yang dag par bgro ba'i rnam grangs dang / gdags pa'i bstan bcos dang / chos kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: ye shes la 'jug pa dang / rab tu byed pa'i rkang pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs dang / yang dag par bgro ba'i rnam grangs dang / gdags pa'i bstan bcos dang / chos kyi phung po'o //
translated: the Abhidharma of Entering Awareness, the Abhidharma of the Bases of Mindfulness, the Abhidharma of the Collection of Higher Knowledge, the Abhidharma of the Enumeration of Topics, the Abhidharma of the Treatise on Designations, and the Abhidharma of the Collection of Dharmas.

original: 'di skad du sgo nga gang dag gis ma las brtsams nas dran pas mi brjed ba zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di skad du sgo nga gang dag gis ma las brtsams nas dran pas mi brjed ba zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: The text reads: ‚ÄúThose who are born from eggs, beginning with the mother, are not forgotten by memory.‚Äù

original: lus nur nur por gyur pa de dag la ma'i yul can gyi dran pa yod do zhes ji ltar brjod par bya /
analyzed: lus nur nur por gyur pa de dag la ma'i yul can gyi dran pa yod do zhes ji ltar brjod par bya /
translated: How can it be said that the mother has memory of the embryo in the form of a kalala?üîΩFor this very reason, the enumeration of the aggregates states: ‚ÄúThose who are born from eggs, beginning with the mother,‚Äù because there is no memory in eggs.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na bgro ba'i rnam grangs las ma dag gis sgo nga las brtsams te zhes 'don te sgo nga dag la dran pa med pa'i phyir ro zhen de'i phyir reg pa'i gnas skabs de dran pas zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na bgro ba'i rnam grangs las ma dag gis sgo nga las brtsams te zhes 'don te sgo nga dag la dran pa med pa'i phyir ro zhen de'i phyir reg pa'i gnas skabs de dran pas zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the state of contact is remembered.

original: gal te zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad srid pa'i rjes su 'jug par gnas pa'i byed rgyu yin ba'i phyir srid pa rnams gso bar byed pa dag ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad srid pa'i rjes su 'jug par gnas pa'i byed rgyu yin ba'i phyir srid pa rnams gso bar byed pa dag ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If all contaminated phenomena are the cause of the generation of existence, why are only four nutriments stated to nourish existence?

original: gtso bor bshad de zas bzhi zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gtso bor bshad de zas bzhi zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: They are stated as the primary causes, and they are called the four nutriments.

original: rgyu gnyis dang rkyen gnyis kyis yang dag pa'i lta ba skyed bar byed de /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis dang rkyen gnyis kyis yang dag pa'i lta ba skyed bar byed de /
translated: Correct view is generated by two causes and two conditions.

original: zhes gtso bo'i sgo nas ston pa yang mthong ste /
analyzed: zhes gtso bo'i sgo nas ston pa yang mthong ste /
translated: It is also seen that the Buddha teaches primarily in terms of the principal cause.

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la sogs pa dag kyang de skye ba'i rgyu ma yin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la sogs pa dag kyang de skye ba'i rgyu ma yin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: However, it is not that pure morality, etc. are not causes for its arising.

original: bzhi po 'di dag nyid da ltar ba'i skye ba gso ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba 'phen pa dang 'grub pa dag la gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag nyid da ltar ba'i skye ba gso ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba 'phen pa dang 'grub pa dag la gtso bo yin te /
translated: These four are principal in nourishing the present birth, in projecting and establishing the future birth.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'di la gnas dang ni /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'di la gnas dang ni /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says:

original: brten pa rgyas pa'i don du gnyis zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: brten pa rgyas pa'i don du gnyis zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Here, the two are for the nourishment of the support and the supported.

original: gso bar bya ba dang @403b bskyed par bya ba'i chos ni gnyis te gzugs dang ming ngo //
analyzed: gso bar bya ba dang @403b bskyed par bya ba'i chos ni gnyis te gzugs dang ming ngo //
translated: The dharmas to be nourished and generated are two: form and name.

original: de la gzugs ni rten te dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus so //
analyzed: de la gzugs ni rten te dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus so //
translated: Among them, form is the support, i.e., the body together with the sense faculties.

original: ming ni brten pa ste sems rang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: ming ni brten pa ste sems rang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: Name is the supported, i.e., mind and mental factors.

original: de la rten rgyas par byed ba na kham gyi zas te 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs ni de la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rten rgyas par byed ba na kham gyi zas te 'dod pa na spyod pa'i gzugs ni de la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, the nourishment of the support is the nourishment of the body by means of the four types of food, because the form of the desire realm is supported on it.

original: brten pa rgyas par byed pa ni reg ba ste /
analyzed: brten pa rgyas par byed pa ni reg ba ste /
translated: The one that nourishes is contact.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni nges 'tsho ba'i phyir ta /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni nges 'tsho ba'i phyir ta /
translated: Because mind and mental factors are definitely nourished.

original: de skad du yang tshor ba'i phung po dang 'du shes kyi phung po dang 'du byed kyi phung po gang ci yod pa de dag ni reg pa la brten nas yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skad du yang tshor ba'i phung po dang 'du shes kyi phung po dang 'du byed kyi phung po gang ci yod pa de dag ni reg pa la brten nas yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is said, Whatever there is of the aggregate of feeling, the aggregate of conception, and the aggregate of formations, all of that is based on contact.

original: yid la sems pas ni ming dang gzugs kyi bdag nyid kyi yang srid 'phen par byed de /
analyzed: yid la sems pas ni ming dang gzugs kyi bdag nyid kyi yang srid 'phen par byed de /
translated: Attention projects the selfexistence of name and form.

original: yid la sems pa ni yang srid pa 'phen pa'i las kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid la sems pa ni yang srid pa 'phen pa'i las kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because attention is the nature of the karma that projects rebirth.

original: ji ltar 'phen par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phen par byed ce na /
translated: How does it project?

original: rgyu de skye ba dang mthun par gnas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu de skye ba dang mthun par gnas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it maintains the cause in a way that accords with the arising of the effect.

original: las kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sa bon las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: las kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sa bon las zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: From the seed of consciousness that is infused by karma.

original: bsgos pa ni las kyis 'phangs pa'i yang srid pa bskyed pa'i nus pa ste /
analyzed: bsgos pa ni las kyis 'phangs pa'i yang srid pa bskyed pa'i nus pa ste /
translated: Infused means the potency to generate rebirth that is projected by karma.

original: 'di ltar srid pas ni las kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sa bon brlan par byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar srid pas ni las kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sa bon brlan par byed la /
translated: Thus, existence moistens the seed of consciousness that is impregnated by action.

original: des ni ming dang gzugs gzhan mngon par 'grub par byed de /
analyzed: des ni ming dang gzugs gzhan mngon par 'grub par byed de /
translated: And that causes the other, i.e., name-and-form, to come into existence.

original: brlan gyis rjes su zin pa'i sa bon gyis myu gu 'grub par byed ba bzhin no //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir las ni skye ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: brlan gyis rjes su zin pa'i sa bon gyis myu gu 'grub par byed ba bzhin no // de nyid kyi phyir las ni skye ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: Just as a seed that is moistened by water causes the sprout to come into existence.

original: sred pa ni mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sred pa ni mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: That is why action is the cause of birth and craving is the cause of coming into existence.

original: rim gyis 'jig pa ni mngon sum du rgyu dang 'bras bu bstan pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: rim gyis 'jig pa ni mngon sum du rgyu dang 'bras bu bstan pa nyid kyis te /
translated: The gradual destruction of the world is taught by the direct teaching of cause and effect.

original: ming dang gzugs thog ma med ba nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs thog ma med ba nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that name-and-form is without beginning,

original: mtha' snga ma med pa de'i phyir 'dir yang grub pa kho na skye bar bstan to //
analyzed: mtha' snga ma med pa de'i phyir 'dir yang grub pa kho na skye bar bstan to //
translated: it is taught that here only that which is already established is born, because it has no prior limit.

original: snga ma gnyis ni kham dang reg pa dag go //
analyzed: snga ma gnyis ni kham dang reg pa dag go //
translated: The first two are food and contact.

original: phyi ma gnyis ni yid la sems pa dang rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma gnyis ni yid la sems pa dang rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The last two are mental intention and consciousness.

original: mu bzhi ni kham yin la /
analyzed: mu bzhi ni kham yin la /
translated: The four possibilities are:

original: zas ma yin pa dang / zas yin la kham ma yin pa dang / gnyis ka yin pa dang gnyis ka ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zas ma yin pa dang / zas yin la kham ma yin pa dang / gnyis ka yin pa dang gnyis ka ma yin pa'o //
translated: Food that is not morsel food, food that is morsel food and not food, food that is both, and food that is neither.

original: mu gnyis pa ni kham las gzhan pa'i zas gsum rnams so //üîΩbzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mu gnyis pa ni kham las gzhan pa'i zas gsum rnams so // bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The second possibility is the three foods that are not morsels.

original: zhes @404a * //
analyzed: zhes @404a * //
translated: The fourth possibility is that which is not included in those.

original: bya ba ni sgra dang tshor ba sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad de /
analyzed: bya ba ni sgra dang tshor ba sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad de /
translated: This is sound and all minds and mental factors that are associated with painful feeling.

original: de bzhin du reg pa la sogs pa dag la yang ci rigs par mu bzhir bya'o zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du reg pa la sogs pa dag la yang ci rigs par mu bzhir bya'o zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: Similarly, contact and so on should be applied in the four possibilities as appropriate.

original: ji ltar zhe na gang la reg pa yin pa de thams cad zas kyang yin nam /üîΩreg pa yin la zas ma yin pa yang yod /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na gang la reg pa yin pa de thams cad zas kyang yin nam / reg pa yin la zas ma yin pa yang yod /
translated: What is this like? Is everything that is contact also food?üîΩThere is contact that is not food.

original: zas yin la reg pa ma yin pa yang yod /üîΩgnyis ka yin pa yang yod /
analyzed: zas yin la reg pa ma yin pa yang yod / gnyis ka yin pa yang yod /
translated: There is food that is not contact.üîΩThere is that which is both.

original: gnyis ka ma yin pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gnyis ka ma yin pa yang yod do //
translated: There is that which is neither.

original: mu dang po ni reg pa gang la brten nas dbang po rnams nyams par 'gyur la 'byung ba chen po rnams kyang yongs su 'jig par 'gyur ba'o ;
analyzed: mu dang po ni reg pa gang la brten nas dbang po rnams nyams par 'gyur la 'byung ba chen po rnams kyang yongs su 'jig par 'gyur ba'o ;
translated: The first possibility is contact that causes the faculties to deteriorate and the great elements to disintegrate.

original: / gnyis pa ni reg pa las gzhan pa'i zas gsum dag go //
analyzed: / gnyis pa ni reg pa las gzhan pa'i zas gsum dag go //
translated: The second is the three other types of nutriment besides contact.

original: gsum pa ni reg pa gang la brten nas dbang po rnams rgyas par 'gyur zhing 'byung ba chen po rnams kyang 'phel bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni reg pa gang la brten nas dbang po rnams rgyas par 'gyur zhing 'byung ba chen po rnams kyang 'phel bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The third is contact that causes the faculties to develop and the great elements to increase.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The fourth is that which is not included in those three.

original: de bzhin du yid la sems pa dang ; rnam par shes pa la mu bzhi yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du yid la sems pa dang ; rnam par shes pa la mu bzhi yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: Similarly, the four possibilities should be stated for intention and consciousness.üîΩContact and so on are explained as nutriment without differentiation as causes that increase the faculties and causes that increase the great elements. Therefore the root text asks:

original: reg pa la sogs pa dbang po rgyas pa'i rgyu dang / 'byung ba chen po 'phel ba'i rgyu rnams khyad par med par zas nyid du bshad pa de'i phyir reg pa la sogs pa la brten nas zhes bya ba rgya cher dris te /
analyzed: reg pa la sogs pa dbang po rgyas pa'i rgyu dang / 'byung ba chen po 'phel ba'i rgyu rnams khyad par med par zas nyid du bshad pa de'i phyir reg pa la sogs pa la brten nas zhes bya ba rgya cher dris te /
translated: ‚ÄúDo the faculties develop and the great elements increase in dependence on contact and so on?‚Äù

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rnam par shes pa dang sems pa gnyis bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rnam par shes pa dang sems pa gnyis bsdu'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes both consciousness and intention.

original: yod de gzhan gyi sa pa dang zag pa med pa rnams so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yod de gzhan gyi sa pa dang zag pa med pa rnams so zhes bya ba la /
translated: They exist in the form realm and the formless realm.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: The following is taught:

original: reg pa la sogs pa rang gis ba rnams kho na dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po rgyas par byed pa na zas yin gyi gzhan gyis pa rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: reg pa la sogs pa rang gis ba rnams kho na dbang po dang 'byung ba chen po rgyas par byed pa na zas yin gyi gzhan gyis pa rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: Contact and so on that are homogeneous only act as food when they nourish the faculties and the great elements, but not when they are heterogeneous.

original: kham gang la brten nas dbang po nyams par 'gyur la zhes bya ba 'byung ba de'i phyir gang zhig zos nas gnod par byed ba de zas ma yin pa nyid du thal bas de'i phyir gang zhig zos na zhes bya ba rgya cher smos so //
analyzed: kham gang la brten nas dbang po nyams par 'gyur la zhes bya ba 'byung ba de'i phyir gang zhig zos nas gnod par byed ba de zas ma yin pa nyid du thal bas de'i phyir gang zhig zos na zhes bya ba rgya cher smos so //
translated: Since it is said, ‚ÄúThat which is relied upon to impair the faculties,‚Äù it follows that that which is harmful when eaten is not food. Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThat which is eaten and nourishes the faculties and the great elements.

original: 'di nyid la rgyu smras pa ni dang po phan 'dogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid la rgyu smras pa ni dang po phan 'dogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
translated: ‚Äù The reason for this is stated: ‚ÄúBecause it benefits at the beginning.

original: bye brag tu smra ba smos pa ni mu bzhi la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba smos pa ni mu bzhi la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äù The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say this because it is harmed by the four possibilities.

original: rgyas par 'gyur ba'i zas la dgongs te gsungs pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyas par 'gyur ba'i zas la dgongs te gsungs pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba la /
translated: There is no contradiction, because it is stated with reference to food that nourishes.

original: rgyas par 'gyur ba'i zas la dgongs pas mu bzhi bshad pa dang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: rgyas par 'gyur ba'i zas la dgongs pas mu bzhi bshad pa dang mi 'gal lo //
translated: There is no contradiction with the explanation of the four possibilities, because it is stated with reference to food that nourishes.

original: @404b nyams par 'gyur ba'i zas ni dmyal bdag tu zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: @404b nyams par 'gyur ba'i zas ni dmyal bdag tu zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: Food that causes harm is in hell.

original: bkres pa dang skom pa 'joms par nus pa nyid ni kham gyi zas kyi mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: bkres pa dang skom pa 'joms par nus pa nyid ni kham gyi zas kyi mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: The definition of oral food is that which is able to destroy hunger and thirst.

original: dmyal ba dag na yang lcags kyi tho lum 'bar ba dang / zangs zhun mas bkres ba dang skom pa dag 'joms bar nus pa 'di zas nyid du mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: dmyal ba dag na yang lcags kyi tho lum 'bar ba dang / zangs zhun mas bkres ba dang skom pa dag 'joms bar nus pa 'di zas nyid du mi 'gal lo //
translated: In the hells, burning iron balls and molten copper are able to destroy hunger and thirst.

original: ji ltar 'joms she na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'joms she na /
translated: How does it destroy them?

original: 'joms so zhes ni mi smra'i 'on kyang 'joms par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'joms so zhes ni mi smra'i 'on kyang 'joms par nus pa yin no //
translated: We do not say it destroys them, but it is able to destroy them.

original: gal te 'joms par nus na ji ltar mi 'joms she na /
analyzed: gal te 'joms par nus na ji ltar mi 'joms she na /
translated: If it is able to destroy them, why does it not destroy them?

original: gang gis na 'joms par mi 'gyur ba me'i khams shas tshe ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: gang gis na 'joms par mi 'gyur ba me'i khams shas tshe ba'i phyir ram /
translated: It does not destroy them because the fire element is predominant.

original: sems can rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa de dang 'dra ba yin pas so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa de dang 'dra ba yin pas so //
translated: The homogeneous character of sentient beings is similar to that.

original: kham gyi zas kyi zhar la 'di yang dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: kham gyi zas kyi zhar la 'di yang dpyad par bya ste /
translated: This should be investigated in connection with the food of morsel.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ngo //
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: @406a * // 'khrul pa'i skye ba smos pa ni /

translated: The mention of deluded birth is

original: rang gi sa pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis kyang 'chi 'pho ba dang skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi sa pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis kyang 'chi 'pho ba dang skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One does not die and is not born through a concentrated mind of one's own level.

original: sbyor ba las ltos pa'i phyir na mngon par 'du byed pa las @406b byung ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba las ltos pa'i phyir na mngon par 'du byed pa las @406b byung ba'o //
translated: It is born of application because it depends on application.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir na phan 'dogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir na phan 'dogs par byed pa'o //
translated: It is helpful because it is associated with pliancy.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba'i sems ni gsal ba'i phyir chad pa dang rjes su mthun bam yin la /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba'i sems ni gsal ba'i phyir chad pa dang rjes su mthun bam yin la /
translated: The mind born of application is clear, and so it is not suitable as death because it is not compatible with death.

original: 'chi ba'i sems ni gnod par byed ba yin zhing mnyam par gzhag pa ni phan 'dogs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i sems ni gnod par byed ba yin zhing mnyam par gzhag pa ni phan 'dogs par byed pa yin te /
translated: The mind of death is harmful, and meditative equipoise is helpful.

original: de'i phyir de las 'chi 'pho bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de las 'chi 'pho bar mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not suitable to die while in meditative equipoise.

original: gang gi phyir skye ba'i sems ni nyon mongs pa can yin la mnyam par gzhag pa ni dge ba yin pas des ni skye bar yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye ba'i sems ni nyon mongs pa can yin la mnyam par gzhag pa ni dge ba yin pas des ni skye bar yang mi rigs so //
translated: Also, it is not suitable to be born while in meditative equipoise because the mind of birth is afflicted and meditative equipoise is virtuous.

original: gnas skabs de ni zhan pa yin la mnyam par gzhag pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba yin pa'i phyir gsal ba yin pas gnas skabs de na de med pa'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pas skye ba ga la yod /
analyzed: gnas skabs de ni zhan pa yin la mnyam par gzhag pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba yin pa'i phyir gsal ba yin pas gnas skabs de na de med pa'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pas skye ba ga la yod /
translated: That state is weak and clear since it arises from manifest effort. Therefore, since it does not exist in that state, how could it arise through equipoise?

original: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i nyon mongs pa can yang phan 'dogs pa'i phyir med pa der gnas kyang 'chi 'pho'o //
analyzed: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i nyon mongs pa can yang phan 'dogs pa'i phyir med pa der gnas kyang 'chi 'pho'o //
translated: Also, though it exists in that state, it dies and transmigrates since it does not assist afflicted states of different realm.

original: mngon par 'du byed ba las byung ba'i phyir skye ba med do //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed ba las byung ba'i phyir skye ba med do //
translated: It does not arise since it arises from manifest effort.

original: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i nyon mongs pa can autkrishta sa pa de ji ltar rkyen gzhan gyi sa la skye bar byed /
analyzed: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i nyon mongs pa can autkrishta sa pa de ji ltar rkyen gzhan gyi sa la skye bar byed /
translated: How does that afflicted state of different realm arise in the condition of another level?

original: sems med pa la yang med de zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: sems med pa la yang med de zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: It does not exist in the mindless states.

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba gnyis zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba gnyis zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is applied to both death and rebirth.

original: sems med pa ni 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs ba dang / 'du shes med pa par nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sems med pa ni 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs ba dang / 'du shes med pa par nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: The mindless state is the meditative attainment of nonperception, the meditative attainment of cessation, and the state of nondiscernment.

original: gnod par byar mi nus pa ni dug dang mtshon dang rdo rje la sogs pa rnams kyis te /
analyzed: gnod par byar mi nus pa ni dug dang mtshon dang rdo rje la sogs pa rnams kyis te /
translated: It is not harmed by poison, weapons, vajras, and so on.

original: de'i phyir sems med pa la 'chi 'pho ba med do zhes bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems med pa la 'chi 'pho ba med do zhes bya bar bstan to //
translated: Therefore it is taught that death does not exist for mindless beings.

original: gang gi tshe 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa'am /
translated: When one enters meditative attainment of cessation or the meditative attainment of nonperception,üîΩor when one possesses the state of nondiscernment, then the body is destroyed through the exhaustion of the life force projected by previous karma.

original: 'du shes med pa dang ldan pa de sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa'i tshe zad pas lus yongs su 'gyur par bcom pa de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa'i ris mthun pa 'chad pa dang mthun par gnas pa'i tshe zhes bya ba'i don
analyzed: 'du shes med pa dang ldan pa de sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa'i tshe zad pas lus yongs su 'gyur par bcom pa de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa'i ris mthun pa 'chad pa dang mthun par gnas pa'i tshe zhes bya ba'i don
translated: At that time, the meaning is that the homogeneous collection of parts projected by previous karma is destroyed.

original: to // lus dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni lus la sa bon gyi ngo bor gnas zhes bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: to // lus dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni lus la sa bon gyi ngo bor gnas zhes bya ba'i don no //
translated: ‚ÄúIn relation to the body‚Äù means ‚Äúin the body, in the nature of a seed.‚ÄùüîΩAccording to another opinion, the mental stream is bound to the body by the attachment to pleasure.

original: gzhan dag na re lus la sred pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'brel lo zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re lus la sred pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'brel lo zhe'o //
translated: The other masters say: ‚ÄúThe mental stream of the perfected beings who are absorbed in the attainment of cessation is bound to the body by the condition of the same type, for the mind of entry into the attainment is of the same type as the mind of leaving the attainment.

original: gzhan ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis ldang ba'i sems skye bar nges par byas pa'i phyir de'i tshe yang de @407a * //
analyzed: gzhan ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis ldang ba'i sems skye bar nges par byas pa'i phyir de'i tshe yang de @407a * //
translated: Thus, at the moment when the perfected being leaves the attainment of cessation, the mind of entry into the attainment, which is of the same type, necessarily manifests itself, for the mind of leaving the attainment is not of the same type as the mind of entry into the attainment.üîΩThe mind of entry into the attainment is a mind of the realm of desire, a mind of the realm of fine-materiality, a mind of the realm of immateriality, a pure mind.

original: la gdon mi za bar do'i lus dang 'brel pa'i sems mngon du 'gyur te /üîΩmtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis drangs pa'i chos skye ba ni sus kyang dgag par mi nus so //
analyzed: la gdon mi za bar do'i lus dang 'brel pa'i sems mngon du 'gyur te / mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis drangs pa'i chos skye ba ni sus kyang dgag par mi nus so //

original: sems cad de dag 'du shes bskyed nas gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i lung gis kyang sems med pa la 'chi 'pho med do zhes shes par byed do //
analyzed: sems cad de dag 'du shes bskyed nas gnas de nas 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i lung gis kyang sems med pa la 'chi 'pho med do zhes shes par byed do //
translated: The mind of leaving the attainment is an

original: sems 'chad pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sems 'chad pa'i rgyu ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sems 'chad pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sems 'chad pa'i rgyu ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa dag yin no //
translated: The cause for the mind to be interrupted is the meditative attainment of cessation and so on.

original: de dag ni skye ba'i tshe 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: de dag ni skye ba'i tshe 'byung ba med do //
translated: But when it arises, the mind does not arise from the primary elements.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa nas srid rtse'i mthar thug pa'i sems ni sems 'chad pa'i rgyu'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa nas srid rtse'i mthar thug pa'i sems ni sems 'chad pa'i rgyu'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The mind from the fourth absorption to the summit of existence is the cause for the mind to be interrupted.

original: gnas skabs su srid pa med do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas skabs su srid pa med do zhes bya ba la /
translated: There is no existence in the interim.

original: skye ba yang gcig tu nyon mongs pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba yang gcig tu nyon mongs pa can ma yin no //
translated: Also, birth is not a single afflicted state.

analyzed: sems med par yang nyon mongs pa 'byung ba med pas sems med pa la skye pa med do //
translated: Afflictions do not arise in the absence of mind, therefore birth does not occur in the absence of mind.

analyzed: kun dga' bo gal te rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du mi 'jug na ni zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //

original: 'chi ba'i srid pa rnam pa gsum du bshad pa la ste /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i srid pa rnam pa gsum du bshad pa la ste /
translated: The three types of death existence are explained.

analyzed: gzhan rnam gsum zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúThe other three types.‚Äù

analyzed: dgra bcom pa la ni nyon mongs pa can gyi sems yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Arhats do not have afflicted minds.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /üîΩdge ba dang lung ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / dge ba dang lung ma bstan pa'o //
translated: What then?

original: de la yang /
analyzed: de la yang /
translated: They have virtuous minds and neutral minds.üîΩAnd they have two neutral minds:üîΩOne that is liberated and one that is not liberated.

original: mya ngan 'da' lung bstan min gnyis te 'dir ni lung du ma bstan pa gnyis kho na mya ngan las 'da'o zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: mya ngan 'da' lung bstan min gnyis te 'dir ni lung du ma bstan pa gnyis kho na mya ngan las 'da'o zhes brjod kyi /
translated: Here, only the two neutral minds are said to attain nirvana,

original: dgra bcom pa kho na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa kho na ni ma yin no //
translated: but not arhats alone.

original: nying mtshams sbyar ba med pa'i 'chi ba kho na la mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyar ba med pa'i 'chi ba kho na la mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Only death without rebirth is called nirvana.üîΩIf there is neutral karmic maturation in the desire realm,
