analyzed: gal te 'dod pa'i khams na rnam par smin pa btang snyoms yod na zhes bya ba ni 'og na yang bar ma yod do zhes kha cig zer te /
translated: some say: The neutral state exists below it too.

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩbsam gtan khyad par rnam smin las //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / bsam gtan khyad par rnam smin las //
translated: Because it is said:

original: snga phyi med gsum smin 'dod phyir //
analyzed: snga phyi med gsum smin 'dod phyir //
translated: The special meditative attainment of absorption is asserted to be the karmic maturation of the three, not past or future.

original: zhes bya ba'i kha cig gi lugs yongs su bzung nas smras pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i kha cig gi lugs yongs su bzung nas smras pa'o //
translated: This is said by accepting the system of some.

original: kha cig ni bsam gtan gsum pa yan chad na las bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba yod par 'dod de /
analyzed: kha cig ni bsam gtan gsum pa yan chad na las bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba yod par 'dod de /
translated: Some assert that in the third absorption and above there is karma to be experienced that is neither pleasure nor pain.

original: de dag gi ltar na ji ste med na ni spyod lam pa kho na la'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na ji ste med na ni spyod lam pa kho na la'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: If it does not exist there, then it exists in the desire realm alone.

original: @407b gzhan la ma yin zhes bya ba ni dge ba la ma yin zhes bya ba'i don te nyon mongs pa can ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @407b gzhan la ma yin zhes bya ba ni dge ba la ma yin zhes bya ba'i don te nyon mongs pa can ni mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not exist in other realms means it does not exist in the virtuous mind because afflicted states are impossible there.

original: dge ba'i sems ni stobs dang ldan pa'i phying sems 'chad pa'i rjes su mthun pa ma yin la /
analyzed: dge ba'i sems ni stobs dang ldan pa'i phying sems 'chad pa'i rjes su mthun pa ma yin la /
translated: The virtuous mind is powerful and thus it is not compatible with the severance of mind.

original: nyam chung ba'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa ni sems 'chad pa'i rjes su mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: nyam chung ba'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa ni sems 'chad pa'i rjes su mthun pa yin te /
translated: The neutral mind is weak and thus it is compatible with the severance of mind.

original: 'dir sems 'chad pa ni sems nyid mtshams sbyor ba med par 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir sems 'chad pa ni sems nyid mtshams sbyor ba med par 'gag pa'o //
translated: Here the severance of mind is the cessation of mind without linking to another mind.

original: yid bde ba dang mtshungs bar ldan pa rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i yas kyi rjes su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed de /
analyzed: yid bde ba dang mtshungs bar ldan pa rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i yas kyi rjes su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed de /
translated: One who is endowed with mental satisfaction and who is born from karmic maturation attains nirvana through the upper door.

original: da ni gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ni gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is clear.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'dir nges par 'chi 'pho skye ba btang snyoms pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'dir nges par 'chi 'pho skye ba btang snyoms pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: This is why the text says: ‚ÄúThe one who dies and passes away from there is indifferent to rebirth.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag na re dge ba ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas ba yin pa'i phyir dang / dgra bcom pa rnams kyang ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par smin pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa yin pa'i phyir dge ba'i sems la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yod pa ma yin no zhe'o //üîΩ'di rnam par smin pa las skyes pa nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dge ba ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas ba yin pa'i phyir dang / dgra bcom pa rnams kyang ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par smin pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa yin pa'i phyir dge ba'i sems la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yod pa ma yin no zhe'o // 'di rnam par smin pa las skyes pa nyid du yang thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: According to another opinion, the perfected being does not enter into nirvƒÅ·πáa in the wholesome thought, because this thought is accompanied by the acquisition of retribution, and because the perfected being has turned his back on any future retribution.üîΩBut, we would say, this thought would then be unobscured-non-defined?

original: de la ji ltar yang phyir phyogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ji ltar yang phyir phyogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, for the perfected being has definitely rejected the life-force.

original: lus kyi phyogs gang du rnam par shes pa 'gag ce na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus kyi phyogs gang du rnam par shes pa 'gag ce na zhes bya ba la /
translated: In what part of the body does the consciousness of the perfected being cease?

original: rnam par shes pa bstan du med pa ni yul na gnas par mi rung la khyad par du yang yid kyi rnam par shes par mi rung mod kyi /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bstan du med pa ni yul na gnas par mi rung la khyad par du yang yid kyi rnam par shes par mi rung mod kyi /
translated: The consciousness is not susceptible of being localized, since it is immaterial.

original: de ni 'dir lus kyi dbang po 'gag par nges pa'i sgo nas brjod do //üîΩmod la 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni lus kyi dbang po de la rag las te /
analyzed: de ni 'dir lus kyi dbang po 'gag par nges pa'i sgo nas brjod do // mod la 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni lus kyi dbang po de la rag las te /
translated: This is what is meant here by the cessation of the body sense-faculty.üîΩThe mental faculty and the consciousnesses that are associated with it cease immediately after the body sense-faculty.

original: 'jug pa'i yid dang bcas pa mtha' dag skad cig tsam de nyid la 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i yid dang bcas pa mtha' dag skad cig tsam de nyid la 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the mental faculty and the consciousnesses that are associated with it cease in the very moment that the body sense-faculty ceases.

original: grangs bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: grangs bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
translated: According to the order,

original: ngan song du 'gro ba rnams kyi ni rkang pa dag tu'o //
analyzed: ngan song du 'gro ba rnams kyi ni rkang pa dag tu'o //
translated: those who are going to the bad destinies die with their feet drawn up.

original: mi'i nang du 'gro ba rnams kyi ni lte bar ro //
analyzed: mi'i nang du 'gro ba rnams kyi ni lte bar ro //
translated: Those who are going to the human realm die with their bellies drawn in.

original: lha'i nang du 'gro ba rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams kyi ni snying gar ro //
analyzed: lha'i nang du 'gro ba rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams kyi ni snying gar ro //
translated: Those who are going to the celestial realm and the arhats die with their heads drawn in.

original: gzhan dag na re dgra bcom pa rnams kyi ni spyi bor te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dgra bcom pa rnams kyi ni spyi bor te /
translated: According to others, the arhats die with their heads drawn in,

original: lus kyi dbang po der 'gag pa'i phyir de dang 'brel pa'i rnam par shes pa yang der 'gag go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po der 'gag pa'i phyir de dang 'brel pa'i rnam par shes pa yang der 'gag go zhes zer ro //
translated: because the mental faculty and the consciousnesses that are associated with it cease in the head.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ji ltar lus kyi dbang po dang 'brel nas 'jug ce na /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ji ltar lus kyi dbang po dang 'brel nas 'jug ce na /
translated: How does the mental consciousness occur in connection with the body sense-faculty?

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams dag na @408a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams dag na @408a * //
translated: In the realm of desire and the realm of fine-materiality, the body sense-faculty does not occur without the foot sense-faculty, etc.

original: lus kyi dbang po med par mi 'byung ba'i phyir rkang pa la sogs pa dag tu 'gag go zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po med par mi 'byung ba'i phyir rkang pa la sogs pa dag tu 'gag go zhes bya ste /
translated: The foot sense-faculty, etc., are thus said to cease in the foot sense-faculty, etc.

original: rgyun gzhan gyi rgyu'i dngos por mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyun gzhan gyi rgyu'i dngos por mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The foot sense-faculty, etc., are not the cause of the arising of another sense-faculty of the same kind.

original: phal cher zhes bya ba ni thams cad ma yin te dge ba byed cing gnad du snun par byed pa ma yin pa rnams cig car 'chi ba'i gnad gcod pa med par 'chi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phal cher zhes bya ba ni thams cad ma yin te dge ba byed cing gnad du snun par byed pa ma yin pa rnams cig car 'chi ba'i gnad gcod pa med par 'chi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression ‚Äúfor the most part‚Äù is used in the stanza because there are exceptions to this rule: those who are virtuous and who are not killed by the destruction of the vital parts die without their vital parts being destroyed.

original: gang zhig de kho na nyid dang de kho na nyid ma yin par spyo ba'i tshig dag gis gzhan dag la gnad du snun par byed pa de ni gnad 'chad pa'i tshor ba dag gi reg par 'gyur gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: gang zhig de kho na nyid dang de kho na nyid ma yin par spyo ba'i tshig dag gis gzhan dag la gnad du snun par byed pa de ni gnad 'chad pa'i tshor ba dag gi reg par 'gyur gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: Those who kill by means of words that are true or false are touched by the sensation of the destruction of the vital parts, but not the others.

original: gnad dag gang gis gcod cing gnad 'chad pa yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnad dag gang gis gcod cing gnad 'chad pa yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are the vital parts? What is the destruction of the vital parts?

analyzed: da ni gang las de don du gnyer bas de dag nye bar len pa dang de yod pa dang med pa ni de rnams yod pa dang med par 'gyur ba myu gu la sogs pa dag la sa bon la sogs pa'i nus pa ci zhig yod /
translated: then what is the potency of seeds and so on with regard to sprouts and so on, such that those who seek sprouts and so on would acquire those and their existence and nonexistence would be the existence and nonexistence of those?

original: 'dis ni mthong ba dang 'gal ba dang 'jig rten dang 'gal bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mthong ba dang 'gal ba dang 'jig rten dang 'gal bar bstan to //
translated: This shows the contradiction with what is seen and the contradiction with the world.

original: de'i rdul phra rab rnams phrad pa lam gtogs par cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba ni myu gu la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab ma mthong bas bskul ba rnams sa bon gyi yul du nye bar 'dug ste /
analyzed: de'i rdul phra rab rnams phrad pa lam gtogs par cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba ni myu gu la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab ma mthong bas bskul ba rnams sa bon gyi yul du nye bar 'dug ste /
translated: There is not the slightest contact of the most subtle particles of the seed with the sprout, because those who are urged by the nonperception of the most subtle particles of the sprout and so on, say that the seed is present in the field of the sprout.

original: de dag ni der phan tshun phrad nas 'bras bu myu gu la sogs pa rtsom mo //
analyzed: de dag ni der phan tshun phrad nas 'bras bu myu gu la sogs pa rtsom mo //
translated: They come together there and commence the effect, the sprout, etc.

original: myu gu la sogs pa dag la sa bon la sogs pa'i nus pa ni de yin gyi myu gu la sogs pa dag la nus pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: myu gu la sogs pa dag la sa bon la sogs pa'i nus pa ni de yin gyi myu gu la sogs pa dag la nus pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The seed, etc. have the power with regard to the sprout, etc., but not vice versa.

original: des na de don du gnyer ba dag gis de dag nye bar len pas mthong ba dang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: des na de don du gnyer ba dag gis de dag nye bar len pas mthong ba dang 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in seeing that those who seek the sprout, etc. take up the seed, etc.üîΩWhy do they assert that in that way?

original: yang ci'i phyir de dag de ltar 'dod ce na zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par sa bon la sogs pa mthong ba'i rgyu yongs su spangs nas ma mthong ba rdul phra rab @422b kyi bdag nyid can brtag par ni rigs pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir de dag de ltar 'dod ce na zhes bya ba ni rgyu med par sa bon la sogs pa mthong ba'i rgyu yongs su spangs nas ma mthong ba rdul phra rab @422b kyi bdag nyid can brtag par ni rigs pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs
translated: If one abandons the cause of seeing the seed, etc. and imagines the cause of seeing the subtle atom, it is not reasonable.

original: so // nges pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: so // nges pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: There would be no certainty.

original: gal te rigs mi mthun pa la rigs mi mthun pa skye na ni de lta na thams cad las thams cad skye bar 'gyur na de ni de ltar na mthong ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te rigs mi mthun pa la rigs mi mthun pa skye na ni de lta na thams cad las thams cad skye bar 'gyur na de ni de ltar na mthong ba yang ma yin no //
translated: If something of a dissimilar type arises from something of a dissimilar type, then everything would arise from everything, but that is not seen.

original: de'i phyir myu gu dang rigs mthun pa'i yan lag dag kho na las myu gu skye bar rigs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir myu gu dang rigs mthun pa'i yan lag dag kho na las myu gu skye bar rigs te /
translated: Therefore, it is logical that a sprout arises only from parts that are of a similar type to itself,

original: sa bon la sogs pa dag las ni ma yin te rigs mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa dag las ni ma yin te rigs mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but not from seeds and so on, because they are not of a similar type.

original: nus pa nges pa'i phyir de ltar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nus pa nges pa'i phyir de ltar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not so, because the potency is restricted.

original: ji ltar sa bon ni nus pa'i khyad par las myu gu'i rdul phra rab dag spro bar byed kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar sa bon ni nus pa'i khyad par las myu gu'i rdul phra rab dag spro bar byed kyi /
translated: Just as a seed projects the subtle particles of a sprout through a specific potency,

original: rdul phra rab gzhan dag ma yin la /
analyzed: rdul phra rab gzhan dag ma yin la /
translated: but not other particles,

original: de dag kyang gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag kyang gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: and those particles are not other,

original: sa bon dang myu gu dang lo ma la sogs pa rnams so sor nus pa tha dad pas myu gu la sogs pa 'bras bu so sor nges pa skyed par byed pa nyid yin pas nges pa med par thal ba med do //
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu dang lo ma la sogs pa rnams so sor nus pa tha dad pas myu gu la sogs pa 'bras bu so sor nges pa skyed par byed pa nyid yin pas nges pa med par thal ba med do //
translated: in the same way, seeds, sprouts, leaves, and so on, because they have different individual potencies, generate individual specific results such as sprouts and so on. Therefore it is not the case that there is the fallacy of indeterminacy.

original: gdon mi za bar nus pa tha dad pa khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar nus pa tha dad pa khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: Undoubtedly, one must accept that there are different potencies.

original: de lta ma yin na rdol yang myu gu la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams phrad par khas blang bar bya dgos la /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rdol yang myu gu la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rnams phrad par khas blang bar bya dgos la /
translated: If it were not so, then even if it were to break, one would have to admit that the atoms of the sprout, etc.

original: der phrad pa rnams kyi 'bras bu skye bar yang khas blang bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: der phrad pa rnams kyi 'bras bu skye bar yang khas blang bar bya dgos so //
translated: come into contact, and that the effect arises from those that have come into contact.

original: dpe shin tu grags pa bstan pa'i phyir sgra dang tshos byed las skye ba 'byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩsgra ni rigs mi mthun pa phrad pa dang bya ba la sogs pa dag las 'byung gi / dri la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pa gzhan las mi 'byung la /
analyzed: dpe shin tu grags pa bstan pa'i phyir sgra dang tshos byed las skye ba 'byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smos so // sgra ni rigs mi mthun pa phrad pa dang bya ba la sogs pa dag las 'byung gi / dri la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pa gzhan las mi 'byung la /
translated: In order to demonstrate a very well known example, he says, ‚Äúlike the arising of sound and cooking.‚ÄùüîΩSound arises from the contact of dissimilar types, such as the hand and the drum, and the like, but not from other dissimilar types, such as smell, etc.

original: chos byed las skyes pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dag kyang tshos par bya ba dang 'tshed pa po rdzas rigs mi mthun pa las skye'i sgra dang bde ba la sogs pa mi mthun pa gzhan las kyang mi 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: chos byed las skyes pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dag kyang tshos par bya ba dang 'tshed pa po rdzas rigs mi mthun pa las skye'i sgra dang bde ba la sogs pa mi mthun pa gzhan las kyang mi 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The form, etc. that arise from the cooking of the elements arise from the cooking and the cooker, which are dissimilar substances, but not from other dissimilar types, such as sound, pleasure, etc.

original: yon tan gyi chos ni sna tshogs yin gyi zhes bya ba ni de ni rigs mthun pa dag las kyang skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan gyi chos ni sna tshogs yin gyi zhes bya ba ni de ni rigs mthun pa dag las kyang skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The qualities of substance are not like this, because they arise from homogeneous causes.

original: de la 'bras bu'i yon tan rgyu'i yon tan sngon du 'gro ba rnams ni rigs mthun pa dag las yin la /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu'i yon tan rgyu'i yon tan sngon du 'gro ba rnams ni rigs mthun pa dag las yin la /
translated: The qualities of the effect that are preceded by the qualities of the cause arise from homogeneous causes.

original: sgra dang tshos byed las skyes pa dang bde ba la sogs pa dag ni rigs tha dad pa dag yin no //
analyzed: sgra dang tshos byed las skyes pa dang bde ba la sogs pa dag ni rigs tha dad pa dag yin no //
translated: Sound, the quality of space, and pleasure, etc., arise from heterogeneous causes.

original: rdzas kyi chos ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: rdzas kyi chos ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: Substance is not like this,

original: de ni rigs mthun pa dag kho na las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rigs mthun pa dag kho na las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises only from homogeneous causes.

original: yang 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod /
analyzed: yang 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the reason for this?

original: nus pa nges pa'o //üîΩyon tan @423a * //üîΩrnams ji lta ba bzhin du rdzas rnams la rigs mi mthun pa brtsam pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nus pa nges pa'o // yon tan @423a * // rnams ji lta ba bzhin du rdzas rnams la rigs mi mthun pa brtsam pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The reason is that the potency is restricted.üîΩThe potency of substances is not like that of the qualities.üîΩThe potency of substances is not like that of the qualities.

original: rdzas rnams la rigs mi mthun pa'i yon tan gyi las rtsom pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rdzas rnams la rigs mi mthun pa'i yon tan gyi las rtsom pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: The potency of substances is not like that of the qualities.

original: yod pa bden mod kyi rdzas rnams la nus pa nges pa ni yon tan gyi las rnams nyid lam mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa bden mod kyi rdzas rnams la nus pa nges pa ni yon tan gyi las rnams nyid lam mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: True, but the potency of the substances is ascertained from the effects of the qualities themselves.

original: 'di ltar rigs mthun pa dag kho na las zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar rigs mthun pa dag kho na las zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, it is said, ‚Äúonly from those of similar type.‚Äù

original: skud pa gcig dang ldan na ras yug mi dmigs pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skud pa gcig dang ldan na ras yug mi dmigs pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because a cloth is not perceived when it has only one thread.

original: gal te skud pa dag las gzhan pa'i ras yug tu gyur pa gang zhig skud pa so so la 'du'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skud pa dag las gzhan pa'i ras yug tu gyur pa gang zhig skud pa so so la 'du'o zhe na /
translated: If a cloth were different from the threads, then it would be perceived when it is in contact with each individual thread.

original: mig dang phrad pa dag las skud pa bzhin du ras yug kyang 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig dang phrad pa dag las skud pa bzhin du ras yug kyang 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But it follows that a cloth would be perceived when it is in contact with the eye, just as a thread is.

original: phrad pa'i khyad par las kyang skud pa bzhin du ras yug dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phrad pa'i khyad par las kyang skud pa bzhin du ras yug dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: And a cloth is not perceived from a particular contact, just as a thread is.

original: de'i phyir skud pa la sogs pa rnam pa de dang deng gnas pa dag kho na la ras yug la sogs pa'i ming de dang de 'thob ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir skud pa la sogs pa rnam pa de dang deng gnas pa dag kho na la ras yug la sogs pa'i ming de dang de 'thob ste /
translated: Therefore, only those threads, etc., that exist in a particular way receive the name cloth, etc.

original: dper na grog ma la sogs pa rnams kyi bkod pa'i khyad par la phreng ba la sogs par ming 'dogs kyi de dag las tha dad pa'i dngos po la ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na grog ma la sogs pa rnams kyi bkod pa'i khyad par la phreng ba la sogs par ming 'dogs kyi de dag las tha dad pa'i dngos po la ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the particular arrangement of ants and so on is designated as a line and so forth, but it is not a different thing from them.

original: yang med pas mi dmigs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: yang med pas mi dmigs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Moreover, it is not only nonobservation due to nonexistence that is a nonobservation;

original: 'o na ci zhe na mthong ba'i gegs byas pas kyang yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na mthong ba'i gegs byas pas kyang yin no snyam na /
translated: if you think that it is also due to the obstruction of seeing,

original: de'i phyir de'i tshe ras yug yod na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i tshe ras yug yod na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: then in response to that, it is said: ‚ÄúIf the cloth existed at that time,‚Äù and so on.

original: dmigs pa'i gegs med bzhin du mi 'dzin pa'i zhes khyad par nye bar bzung ngo //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i gegs med bzhin du mi 'dzin pa'i zhes khyad par nye bar bzung ngo //
translated: The qualification ‚Äúwithout the obstruction of observation‚Äù is added.

original: gang zhig skud pa thams cad la ras yug zad par yod pa yin gyi re re la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig skud pa thams cad la ras yug zad par yod pa yin gyi re re la ni ma yin no //
translated: If the cloth existed in all the threads, it would not exist in each individual thread.

original: de'i phyir skud pa gcig bzung bas ras yug 'dzin pa ma yin te skud pa bzhin de dang phrad pa med pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
analyzed: de'i phyir skud pa gcig bzung bas ras yug 'dzin pa ma yin te skud pa bzhin de dang phrad pa med pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
translated: Therefore, when one thread is apprehended, the cloth is not apprehended, because it does not come into contact with it, as it does with the thread.

original: de'i phyir zad par yod pa ma yin na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir zad par yod pa ma yin na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, if the cloth does not exist in each thread, then

original: gal te skud pa re re dag la ras yug zad par yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te skud pa re re dag la ras yug zad par yod pa ma yin na /
translated: if the cloth does not exist in each thread,

original: de ltar re re la ras yug gi cha yod do zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar re re la ras yug gi cha yod do zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it would be said that each thread has a part of the cloth.

original: de'i phyir skud pa thams cad la ras yug yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skud pa thams cad la ras yug yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the cloth does not exist in all the threads,

original: ras yug gi cha rnams ras yug ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ras yug gi cha rnams ras yug ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the parts of the cloth are not the cloth.

original: 'dus pa tsam ras yug yin par yang 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'dus pa tsam ras yug yin par yang 'gyur gyi /
translated: The mere collection would be the cloth,

original: yan lag can gyi rdzas @423b gcig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yan lag can gyi rdzas @423b gcig ni ma yin te /
translated: but the cloth would not be a single substance that is a whole.

original: skud pa re re la 'du ba'i mang po dag ras yug nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skud pa re re la 'du ba'i mang po dag ras yug nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because each thread is accepted as the many that are the collection of the cloth.üîΩAnd what part of the cloth exists that is different from the threads?

original: skud pa dag las gzhan pa ras yug gi cha yang gang zhig yod ces bya ba ni de dag las tha dad pa'i ras yug gi cha med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skud pa dag las gzhan pa ras yug gi cha yang gang zhig yod ces bya ba ni de dag las tha dad pa'i ras yug gi cha med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no part of the cloth that is different from them.

original: rtsom par byed pa'i yan lag ma gtogs pa'i cha khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang / rdzas gcig rtsom pa med pa'i phyir dang / skud pa bzung na de ma bzung ba'i phyir gang zhig skud pa dag la yod pa skud pa dag las gzhan pa'i ras yug gi cha yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsom par byed pa'i yan lag ma gtogs pa'i cha khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang / rdzas gcig rtsom pa med pa'i phyir dang / skud pa bzung na de ma bzung ba'i phyir gang zhig skud pa dag la yod pa skud pa dag las gzhan pa'i ras yug gi cha yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the part that is not accepted except for the part that is the cause of composition does not exist, because the composition of a single substance does not exist, and because when the thread is apprehended, it is not apprehended, the part of the cloth that exists in the threads and is different from the threads does not exist.

original: ci ste yang ras yug dbang po dang phrad pa la ltos te ;
analyzed: ci ste yang ras yug dbang po dang phrad pa la ltos te ;
translated: But if the cloth is the cause of the perception of the cloth in dependence on contact with the sense faculty,

original: ras yug dmigs pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: ras yug dmigs pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: then the thread is the cause of the perception of the cloth.

original: skud pa gcig dang ldan pa'i tshe na ni rten du ma phrad pa med pas dmigs pa'i phyir ras yug skud pa la yod bzhin du ma dmigs pas khyad par ma grub bo snyam na /
analyzed: skud pa gcig dang ldan pa'i tshe na ni rten du ma phrad pa med pas dmigs pa'i phyir ras yug skud pa la yod bzhin du ma dmigs pas khyad par ma grub bo snyam na /
translated: If you think that since the cloth is perceived when it possesses one thread, the cloth exists in the thread, but is not perceived because the basis, that is, the many threads, is not present, then the distinction is not established.

original: de'i phyir rten du ma zhig dang ldan pa la ltos na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rten du ma zhig dang ldan pa la ltos na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore he says, ‚ÄúIf the cloth is in dependence on the many threads that are its basis,‚Äù and so on.

original: kha tshar tsam mthong na rten du ma dang ldan pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: kha tshar tsam mthong na rten du ma dang ldan pa yod mod kyi /
translated: If you see just the fringe, the many threads that are its basis do exist,

original: ras yug dmigs pa yang ma yin pas /
analyzed: ras yug dmigs pa yang ma yin pas /
translated: but the cloth is not perceived.

original: 'di ras yug dmigs pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ras yug dmigs pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: This is not the cause of the perception of cloth,

original: de yod kyang ras yug ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod kyang ras yug ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even when it exists, cloth is not perceived.

original: ci ste yang ras yug dmigs pa na rten ma lus par dmigs pa la ltos pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste yang ras yug dmigs pa na rten ma lus par dmigs pa la ltos pa yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that when cloth is perceived, it is perceived in dependence on the entire basis,

original: de'i phyir yang na nam yang dmigs par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang na nam yang dmigs par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúOr it would never be perceived,‚Äù and so on.

original: dbus dang pha rol gyi cha rnams dbang po dang ma bral ba'i phyir rten ma lus pa dang phrad pa med pas nam yang ras yug dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbus dang pha rol gyi cha rnams dbang po dang ma bral ba'i phyir rten ma lus pa dang phrad pa med pas nam yang ras yug dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the middle and the parts that are distant are not in contact with the sense faculty, the entire basis is not contacted, and so cloth would never be perceived.

original: gal te yang yan lag thams cad dang cig car phrad pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang yan lag thams cad dang cig car phrad pa med mod kyi /
translated: But even if all the parts are not simultaneously contacted,

original: rim gyis na yod pas ras yug 'dzin par mi 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: rim gyis na yod pas ras yug 'dzin par mi 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: since they are contacted gradually, it is not contradictory for cloth to be apprehended.

original: de'i phyir rim gyis yan lag rnams dang phrad na yang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rim gyis yan lag rnams dang phrad na yang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Therefore NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúEven if the parts are contacted gradually,‚Äù and so on.

original: mig dang reg pa dag rim gyis phrad na yang yan lag dag kho na dang phrad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mig dang reg pa dag rim gyis phrad na yang yan lag dag kho na dang phrad pa yin gyi /
translated: Even if the eye and contact are contacted gradually, only the parts are contacted, not the cloth.

original: nam yang yan lag can dang ma yin pas mig dang reg pas gzung bar bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang yan lag can dang ma yin pas mig dang reg pas gzung bar bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is never a whole, and therefore it is not apprehended by the eye or by touch.üîΩSince the whole is not apprehended by the eye or by touch, it is not a different object from the parts.üîΩSince the whole is not apprehended by the eye or by touch, it is not a different object from the parts.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar ci nas kyang mig dang reg pa dag gi yan lag can don gzhan du gyur pa 'dzin pa ma yin pa de lta bas na rim gyis yan lag @424a * //üîΩcan shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //üîΩgang zhig dngos po phan tshun tha dad pa 'dzin pa la ltos te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar ci nas kyang mig dang reg pa dag gi yan lag can don gzhan du gyur pa 'dzin pa ma yin pa de lta bas na rim gyis yan lag @424a * // can shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo // gang zhig dngos po phan tshun tha dad pa 'dzin pa la ltos te /
translated: Since the whole is not apprehended by the eye or by touch, it is not a different object from the parts.üîΩSince the whole is not apprehended by the eye or by touch, it is not a different object from the parts.

In the same way, even though the previous form, etc. have ceased, the arising of what is produced from cooking is not contradictory to the recognition of a pot because of having a similar shape.

original: yang 'di ji ltar shes na /
